security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation (SKILL.md) describing usage of an external CLI tool. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file access capabilities are defined within the skill itself. Pure knowledge/skill file for guiding agent behavior.

content.user_title: Analyze Beads Dependencies with Graph Metrics
content.value_statement: Beads projects accumulate dependency graphs that are hard to navigate manually. BV computes PageRank, betweenness, cycles, and critical path metrics to help agents prioritize work efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Compute 9 graph metrics including PageRank, betweenness, and eigenvector centrality
Detect circular dependencies and critical path bottlenecks
Generate triage recommendations with unblock information
Export dependency graphs in JSON, DOT, and Mermaid formats
Provide time-travel analysis at historical commits
Group work by labels, tracks, or parallel execution streams
limitations: Requires .beads/beads.jsonl file from bd CLI tool
Phase 2 metrics have 500ms timeout on large graphs
Cannot modify beads data, only read and analyze
Interactive TUI mode blocks agent sessions

use_cases.title: Autonomous task prioritization
use_cases.description: Agents use --robot-triage to get ranked recommendations with claim commands for immediate action

use_cases.title: Bottleneck identification
use_cases.description: Identify high-betweenness nodes that block multiple work streams and delay releases

use_cases.title: Dependency cycle detection
use_cases.description: Find and fix circular dependencies that cause build failures and integration issues

prompt_templates.title: Quick triage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run bv --robot-triage to see recommended tasks, quick wins, and blockers to clear

prompt_templates.title: Bottleneck analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use bv --robot-insights to find nodes with highest betweenness blocking the release

prompt_templates.title: Cycle detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Check bv --robot-insights output for cycles array and fix any circular dependencies found

prompt_templates.title: Parallel planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Run bv --robot-plan --recipe actionable to generate parallel work tracks with unblock lists

output: Quick wins available: 7 tasks with no blockers

best_practices: Always use --robot-* flags for agent sessions to avoid blocking TUI
Check cycles with --robot-insights before starting new work
Use --recipe actionable to filter to ready-to-work items
anti_patterns: Running bare 'bv' command in agent sessions (blocks the session)
Ignoring the status field in robot output (metrics may be approx/timeout)
Working on blocked items without clearing dependencies first

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: BV works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code CLI for agent workflow automation.

faq.question: What graph metrics are computed?
faq.answer: Nine metrics: PageRank, betweenness, HITS, eigenvector, degree, density, cycles, critical path, and topological sort.

faq.question: How does BV integrate with bd CLI?
faq.answer: BV reads .beads/beads.jsonl files created by the bd CLI tool and provides analysis commands for bead triage and planning.

faq.question: Is my bead data safe with BV?
faq.answer: BV only reads existing beads.jsonl files and produces analysis output. It does not modify or transmit any project data.

faq.question: Why are some metrics marked as approx or skipped?
faq.answer: Phase 2 metrics have 500ms timeout. Large graphs over 500 nodes may cause metrics to be approximated or skipped.

faq.question: How does BV compare to other triage tools?
faq.answer: BV pre-computes graph metrics instead of requiring agents to parse raw beads and calculate dependencies manually.
